txt.en: 'I am not so certain about this, but if you insist.'
'I am not so certain about this, but if you insist.'
A concerned farmer sent a note along to you requesting your assistance and asked you to seek a town crier.

'This letter is sent to any who might be willing to help me with a terrible problem. A fox has slipped into my hen house and driven off all my chickens. I need assistance in recovering my prized hens.\n\n'Speak with any town crier to be told of the possible dangers you may face.'
Deliver the letter to a town crier and listen to what they have to say about the concerned farmer.\n\nYou received a letter from a concerned farmer.

'A concerned farmer? Worried about a fox in a hen house? Sounds like a trick to me. You should be careful what you ask for -- but I think I know what this means. If you truly want to go further with this, let me know.'
Town criers warn against it, but they do have a task that can be performed for a concerned farmer.
'I am not so certain about this, but if you insist.'
